pageContext.claim: “We lost one in four auto manufacturing jobs over the last few decades.”
pageContext.analysis: This statement lacks context. Auto and auto parts manufacturing jobs reached a peak of 1.3 million jobs in June, 2000. The number of jobs fell more than half, to 623,000 in June, 2009, the end of the Great Recession. The number of jobs now tops 1 million, but much of that growth predates Trump. Only about 55,000 auto and auto parts jobs have been created since he took the oath of office, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
